workflow.name: Automate SEO keyword & SERP analysis with DataForSEO and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## üß† Automated SEO Keyword and SERP Analysis with DataForSEO for High-Converting Content | n8n workflow template

**Overview üåê**
-----------------
This is a **complete SEO automation workflow** built for professionals who want to manage all their **DataForSEO operations** inside **n8n** ‚Äî no coding required ‚öôÔ∏è  

You can easily **choose your operator (action)**, such as:
- üîç **SERP Analysis** ‚Äì Get ranking data for specific keywords  
- üìà **Keyword Data** ‚Äì Retrieve search volume, CPC, and trends  
- üß† **Competitor Research** ‚Äì Analyze which domains dominate target queries  

Once the workflow runs, it automatically **creates a new Google Sheet** üìä (if it doesn‚Äôt exist) and **appends the results** ‚Äî including metrics like keyword, rank, domain, and date ‚Äî to keep a growing historical record of your SEO data üìÖ  

üí° Ideal for SEO specialists, agencies, and growth teams who want a **single automation** to handle all keyword and ranking data pipelines using **DataForSEO + Google Sheets + n8n**.

---

### **Examples**

![Screenshot 20251025 at 01.30.26.png](fileId:3110)
related keyword sheet

![Screenshot 20251025 at 01.30.37.png](fileId:3109)
Each operator (SERP, Keywords Data, Competitors) automatically creates a separate Google Sheet üìä

---

### üë§ Who‚Äôs it for?

- üß© **SEO Specialists** who need accurate keyword & SERP insights daily  
- ‚úçÔ∏è **Content Marketers** planning new blog posts or landing pages  
- üìä **Digital Marketing Teams** tracking top-performing keywords and competitors  
- üíº **Agencies** managing multiple websites or niches with automated reports  
- üß† **AI-Driven SEOs** building GPT-powered content strategies using live ranking data  

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

1. **Trigger & Input Setup**
   - Start the workflow manually or schedule it to run daily / weekly üïí  
   - Import a keyword list from Google Sheets üìÑ, NocoDB, or an internal database  

2. **Keyword Data Retrieval (DataForSEO Keyword API)**
   - Sends requests to the `keywords_data` endpoint of DataForSEO  
   - Gathers search volume, CPC, competition level, and trend data  
   - Identifies the most promising keywords for conversion-focused content  

3. **SERP Analysis (DataForSEO SERP API)**
   - Fetches the top organic results for each keyword  
   - Extracts domains, titles, snippets, and ranking positions  
   - Highlights which competitors dominate the search landscape  

4. **Data Enrichment & Filtering**
   - Uses Code nodes to clean and normalize the DataForSEO JSON output  
   - Filters out low-intent or irrelevant keywords automatically  
   - Optionally integrates OpenAI or GPT nodes for insight generation ‚ú®  

5. **Store & Visualize**
   - Saves results into **Google Sheets**, **Airtable**, or **NocoDB** for tracking  
   - Each run adds fresh data, building a performance history over time üìà  

6. **Optional AI Layer (Advanced)**
   - Use OpenAI Chat Model to summarize SERP insights:  
     > ‚ÄúTop 3 competitors for *cloud storage pricing* focus on cost transparency ‚Äî recommend including pricing tables.‚Äù  
   - Automatically generate content briefs or keyword clusters  

---

### üß© Workflow Highlights

* ‚ö° **Multiple DataForSEO Endpoints Supported** (`keywords_data`, `serp`, `competitors`)  
* üîÅ **Automated Scheduling** for daily / weekly updates  
* üß† **Data Normalization** for clean, structured SEO metrics  
* üìä **Easy Export** to Google Sheets or NocoDB  
* üß© **Expandable Design** ‚Äî integrate GPT, Google Search Console, or Analytics  
* üåé **Multi-Language & Multi-Location Support** via `language_code` and `location_code`  

---

### üìä Example Output (Google Sheets)

| keyword | rank | domain | volume | cpc | competition | date |
|----------|------|----------------|---------|---------|---------------|------------|
| cloud hosting | 1 | cloud.google.com | 18,100 | $2.40 | 0.62 | 2025-10-25 |
| cloud server | 3 | aws.amazon.com | 12,900 | $3.10 | 0.75 | 2025-10-25 |
| hybrid cloud | 5 | vmware.com | 9,800 | $2.90 | 0.58 | 2025-10-25 |

Each run appends new keyword metrics for trend and performance tracking.

---

### üí° Pro Tips

* üîç Combine this workflow with **Google Search Console** for even richer insights  
* ‚öôÔ∏è Adjust the `location_code` and `language_code` for local SEO targeting  
* üí¨ Add a Slack or Gmail alert to receive weekly keyword opportunity reports  
* ü§ñ Extend with OpenAI to automatically create **content briefs** or **topic clusters**  

---

### üìö Integrations Used

- üß≠ **DataForSEO API** ‚Äì Keyword & SERP data source  
- üìÑ **Google Sheets / Airtable / NocoDB** ‚Äì Storage and visualization  
- ü§ñ **OpenAI Chat Model** (optional) ‚Äì Insight generation and summarization  
- ‚öôÔ∏è **Code Nodes** ‚Äì JSON parsing and custom data processing  

---
### ‚úÖ Features

- üåé **Choose from 100+ Locations**  
  Select your target country, region, or city using the `location_code` parameter.  
  Perfect for local SEO tracking or multi-market analysis.

- üó£Ô∏è **Choose from 50+ Languages**  
  Define the `language_code` to get accurate, language-specific keyword and SERP data.  
  Supports English (`en`), Spanish (`es`), French (`fr`), German (`de`), and more.

- üìä **Auto-Creates Google Sheets for You**  
  No need to manually set up a spreadsheet ‚Äî the workflow automatically **creates a new Google Sheet** (if it doesn‚Äôt exist) and structures it with the right columns (`query`, `rank`, `domain`, `date`, etc.).

- üîÅ **Append New Data Automatically**  
  Every run adds fresh SEO metrics to your sheet, building a continuous daily or weekly ranking history.

- ‚öôÔ∏è **Flexible Operator Selection**  
  Choose which **DataForSEO operator (action)** you want to run:  
  `keywords_data`, `serp`, or `competitors`.  
  Each operator retrieves a different type of SEO insight.

- üß† **Fully Expandable**  
  Add Slack alerts, Airtable sync, or AI summaries using OpenAI ‚Äî all within the same workflow.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è How to Set Up

1. **üîë Add DataForSEO Credentials**  
   - Get your API login from [dataforseo.com](https://dataforseo.com)  
   - Add it under **HTTP Request ‚Üí Basic Auth** in n8n  

2. **üìÑ Connect Google Sheets**  
   - Authorize your Google account  
   - The workflow will **auto-create the sheet** if it doesn‚Äôt exist  

3. **üéõ Choose Operator (Action)**  
   - Pick one: `serp`, `keywords_data`, or `competitors`  
   - Each operator runs a different SEO analysis  

4. **üåç Set Location & Language**  
   - Example: `location_code: 2840` (US), `language_code: en`  

5. **üïí Run or Schedule**  
   - Trigger manually or set a daily schedule  
   - New results will append to your Google Sheet automatically

---

### üì∫ Check Out My Channel

üí¨ Learn more about **SEO Automation, n8n, and AI-powered content workflows**  
üëâ **Connect with me on LinkedIn:** [Nima Salimi](https://linkedin.com/in/nima-salimi-a655a6231)  

Follow for more templates, AI workflows, and SEO automation tutorials üí•

üåê Select the language

parameters.content:
## Get keyword
Get keyword, location, language and operation from user.

nodes.name: Add operation to main sheet in Google Sheets

parameters.content:
## Switch
Choose what operation to do. It gets the operation from user.

## Create a sheet
It creates a sheet that its title is {keyword}{operation}.
fr every operation it create a sheet.

## DataforSEO API Request
Send request to DataforSeo with operation, keyword, location_name and language_name.

## Get the Data from API call
It gets the data that needed from last node and ignores every other fields that we don't need.

## Append data to sheet
This node append the data to the sheet created in 'Create a sheet' node.

## Append data to sheet
This node append the data to the sheet created in 'Create a sheet' node.

main.node: Add operation to main sheet in Google Sheets

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
